summary: The Department of Homeland Security is required by law to report annually on 43 specific measures of border security effectiveness. DHS reported on 35 of those metrics in its 2017 report and generally used data and methods that should produce reliable results. However the report disclosed some, but not all, of the data's limitations. For example, the report didn't indicate that different locations may have...
title: Border Security: DHS Should Improve the Quality of Unlawful Border Entry Information and Other Metric Reporting
